description: Returns a list of kdb environments created in an account.

nested_items.name: environments
nested_items.description: A list of environments in an account.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the kdb environment.

nested_items.name: environmentId
nested_items.description: A unique identifier for the kdb environment.

nested_items.name: awsAccountId
nested_items.description: The unique identifier of the AWS account in which you create the kdb environment.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: The status of the environment creation.
CREATE_REQUESTED --- Environment creation has been requested.
CREATING --- Environment is in the process of being created.
FAILED_CREATION --- Environment creation has failed.
CREATED --- Environment is successfully created and is currently active.
DELETE REQUESTED --- Environment deletion has been requested.
DELETING --- Environment is in the process of being deleted.
RETRY_DELETION --- Initial environment deletion failed, system is reattempting delete.
DELETED --- Environment has been deleted.
FAILED_DELETION --- Environment deletion has failed.

nested_items.name: tgwStatus
nested_items.description: The status of the network configuration.

nested_items.name: dnsStatus
nested_items.description: The status of DNS configuration.

nested_items.name: errorMessage
nested_items.description: Specifies the error message that appears if a flow fails.

nested_items.name: description
nested_items.description: A description of the kdb environment.

nested_items.name: environmentArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of your kdb environment.

nested_items.name: kmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The unique identifier of the KMS key.

nested_items.name: dedicatedServiceAccountId
nested_items.description: A unique identifier for the AWS environment infrastructure account.

nested_items.name: transitGatewayConfiguration
nested_items.description: Specifies the transit gateway and network configuration to connect the kdb environment to an internal network.

nested_items.name: transitGatewayID
nested_items.description: The identifier of the transit gateway created by the customer to connect outbound traffics from kdb network to your internal network.

nested_items.name: routableCIDRSpace
nested_items.description: The routing CIDR on behalf of kdb environment. It could be any '/26 range in the 100.64.0.0 CIDR space. After providing, it will be added to the customer's transit gateway routing table so that the traffics could be routed to kdb network.

nested_items.name: attachmentNetworkAclConfiguration
nested_items.description: The rules that define how you manage the outbound traffic from kdb network to your internal network.

nested_items.name: ruleNumber
nested_items.description: The rule number for the entry. For example 100. All the network ACL entries are processed in ascending order by rule number.

nested_items.name: protocol
nested_items.description: The protocol number. A value of -1 means all the protocols.

nested_items.name: ruleAction
nested_items.description: Indicates whether to allow or deny the traffic that matches the rule.

nested_items.name: portRange
nested_items.description: The range of ports the rule applies to.

nested_items.name: from
nested_items.description: The first port in the range.

nested_items.name: to
nested_items.description: The last port in the range.

nested_items.name: icmpTypeCode
nested_items.description: Defines the ICMP protocol that consists of the ICMP type and code.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The ICMP type. A value of -1 means all types.

nested_items.name: code
nested_items.description: The ICMP code. A value of -1 means all codes for the specified ICMP type.

nested_items.name: cidrBlock
nested_items.description: The IPv4 network range to allow or deny, in CIDR notation. For example, 172.16.0.0/24. We modify the specified CIDR block to its canonical form. For example, if you specify 100.68.0.18/18, we modify it to 100.68.0.0/18.

nested_items.name: customDNSConfiguration
nested_items.description: A list of DNS server name and server IP. This is used to set up Route-53 outbound resolvers.

nested_items.name: customDNSServerName
nested_items.description: The name of the DNS server.

nested_items.name: customDNSServerIP
nested_items.description: The IP address of the DNS server.

nested_items.name: creationTimestamp
nested_items.description: The timestamp at which the kdb environment was created in FinSpace. The value is determined as epoch time in milliseconds. For example, the value for Monday, November 1, 2021 12:00:00 PM UTC is specified as 1635768000000.

nested_items.name: updateTimestamp
nested_items.description: The timestamp at which the kdb environment was modified in FinSpace. The value is determined as epoch time in milliseconds. For example, the value for Monday, November 1, 2021 12:00:00 PM UTC is specified as 1635768000000.

nested_items.name: availabilityZoneIds
nested_items.description: The identifier of the availability zones where subnets for the environment are created.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: certificateAuthorityArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the certificate authority:

nested_items.name: nextToken
nested_items.description: A token that indicates where a results page should begin.
